basics.name: Mohammad Javad Darvishi Bayazi
basics.label: Scientist
basics.summary: MJ is a PhD student at Mila and the University of Montreal (UdeM)

work.summary: Research on Machine Learning and AI, focusing on robustness and reliability of deep learning models.
highlights: Designed and deployed large-scale foundation models for time series forecasting with zero-shot capabilities.
Developed strategies and benchmarks to enhance robustness of deep learning models.
Evaluated over 1000 models for generalization capabilities and human-level behaviors.
Published 7+ peer-reviewed articles in prestigious journals and top-tier conferences.

work.summary: Analyzed signals and images using computational tools to facilitate clinical decision-making.
highlights: Performed statistical analysis on diverse datasets to identify trends and patterns in time series.
Developed pipelines for researchers, medical doctors, and practitioners to study brain function and therapeutic methods.

work.summary: Foundation models for time series analysis.
highlights: Leading development of deep neural networks for time series analysis.

courses: Causality and Information Flow in Multivariate Time Series
Smart Greenhouse Monitoring and Control System Using Industrial Microprocessors

volunteer.summary: Organized events such as the AI4Good event and the AI against COVID-19 competition, and launched the group's website.
highlights: Raised over $20K CAD from Microsoft Canada for AI against COVID-19 competition

volunteer.summary: Designed and organized a Brain-Computer Interface competition.
